comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Mayor of Toledo, Ohio for many years, but more importantly U.S. Ambassador to Belgium (1914-1921), where he figured in Edith Cavell's story. www.nndb.com/people/724/000196136/ Mrs. Whitlock was Ella Brainerd (sister of his first wife, Susan), m. 8-Jun-1895, d. 11-Jul-1942, no children) On Edith Cavell, see www.nndb.com/people/362/000120002/ and notes under www.flickr.com/search/?w=8623220@N02&q=cavell On November 24, 1915, he returned on the Holland-America liner Ryndam from Belgium for a leave due to failing health. He had had a "nervous attack" that kept him confined for 3 weeks, according to the New York Times. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0810F9385B17738...

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks artolog for additional information. We'll add her name to the record.
